channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: UBS posts profit beat but 'material risk' from Trump tariffs darkens outlook
item.description: UBS on Wednesday beat bottom line expectations as the lender seeks to rein in steep share declines that have cost it the crown of continental Europe's...

item.title: Volkswagen posts 37% drop in first-quarter profit, says Trump tariffs could weigh on outlook
item.description: Europe's biggest carmaker reported operating profit of 2.9 billion euros ($3.3 billion) for the first three months of the year.

item.title: Adidas warns tariffs will lead to higher costs on its U.S. products
item.description: "Higher tariffs will eventually cause higher costs for all our products for the US market," Adidas said in a statement.

item.title: Auto giant Stellantis suspends full-year guidance due to uncertainties over Trump tariffs
item.description: Auto giant Stellantis on Wednesday said it was withdrawing its full-year financial guidance due to U.S. tariff uncertainties.

item.title: Snap plunges 13% on 'headwinds' to start quarter, inability to offer guidance
item.description: Snap did not offer an outlook for the second quarter, citing macroeconomic uncertainties.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
item.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trumpâ€™s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
